Author: wookie#7663
Content: do you know what's 50mh in sols?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`Shawn Zcash Foundation Moderator Sep '17

There isn’t a Mega Hash (thousands of hash per second) to Solutions (solutions per second) conversion. Ethereum uses Dagger Hashimoto algorithm, and Zcash uses Equihash algorithm, they are completely different.

Look up the Solutions/s rate based on your Card type: `https://en.m.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=ZCash_mining_GPU_Comparison&stable=0&redirect=no `
(For instance a Nvidia 1080ti gets an average of 650-680 Solutions per Second) then add up your Cards+Solutions and plug that number into:` https://whattomine.com/coins/166-zec-equihash?utf8=✓&hr=680&p=280&fee=0.0&cost=0.1&hcost=0.0&commit=Calculate`
`Then you can calculate your coins/profit per day for your rig.`

Author: IP#9768
Content: 50mh is 89 cents (not counting electriciy)

Author: IP#9768
Content: per day

Author: IP#9768
Content: kmd mining with 1080ti gives 27 cents per day (not counting electricity)

Author: IP#9768
Content: so i mean should be obvious

Author: exploitURcoins#7419

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
"fair"? hash = hash
your percentage of the overall hash doesn't change based on who you pool with
in fact, you *want* ASICs in your pool if you want to get paid on a semi regular basis (20 1080TIs that are overclocked will only find 1 block every 3-5 days)
